summary: An internal FBI email from August 9, 2019, providing a status update on the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. It details statistics from a victim hotline, the identification of victims and co-conspirators, progress on asset forfeiture, and investigative activities including interviews and international coordination.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; his properties and LLC companies are mentioned in relation to asset forfeiture and subpoenas.

events.title: Epstein Investigation Status Update
events.description: Internal FBI email summarizing progress on the Epstein case, including hotline lead analysis, victim identification, co-conspirator interviews, and asset forfeiture actions.

events.title: Appraisal of Epstein's NY Residence
events.description: A certified appraisal was completed for Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence, valuing it at $86,250,000.

keyFacts: Approximately 60 victims had been identified by this date, with potentially hundreds more unidentified; over 20 victims had been interviewed.
Victims reported being sexually abused at multiple Epstein residences in New York, Florida, Little St. James, and New Mexico.
A hotline had generated 147 leads, resulting in 4 individuals being identified as victims and successfully interviewed.
One co-conspirator, residing in London, had not been served; contact was made with UK counterparts to arrange an interview.
A notice of pendency was filed for Epstein's New York residence, appraised at $86.25 million, and subpoenas were served on his Virgin Islands-based LLC companies.
